relational database as a service what this means is that you don't need to concern yourself with the lower level
details of installing configuring or operating your database to launch a new
database you simply go to our Management console you choose the database product that you'd like to launch you choose the
the the horsepower or the what we call the instance type how how large and Powerful of a processor you'd like to
run on and you design the amount of storage you like to have for that database instance if you're going to be
launching Microsoft SQL Server you can choose between the express web standard and even Enterprise editions of SQL
Server 2000 um 2008 R2 once you do this will'll
automatically allocate the proper Hardware we'll allocate the processing the dis space we'll install the software
we'll launch that that for you we will keep the the database server up to date
with at the proper patch level for you and with RDS you have some some really Advanced features such as the ability to
do snapshot backups with a single click in the Management console once you've
made those snapshot backups you can restore those to create a a fresh database that's a a um an accurate
reflection of the database at the time of the backup now there are a number of
ancillary Microsoft products with within the SQL Server Universe uh some of those run within SQL server but others you
could simply run on an on an ec2 instance uh side by side with the SQL
Server the details of this are all in our our documentation so you have a lot of
